title: YOU CANT JUST IGNORE TANKS!
body: Don't yell at me telling me to stop playing around with the tank and focus their back line. Listen, tanks DO damage. Some are supposed to do damage  or else there would be no point to really having one on your team. If a tank like  {{champion:32}} {{champion:31}} {{champion:3}} {{champion:111}}  {{champion:516}} {{champion:78}} {{champion:113}} etc charges for me, I cant just ignore them. I have to either try to kite them to where the fight is, disengage or fight depending on the situation. But I cannot just ignore them or else they'll just kill me.

Not going Tabis on a tank nowadays is incredibly lackluster since in 90% of games there are more AD threats than AP (unless they have support brand but even then it is still a coin flip). Also, as above, most tanks are either top laners which are either in the mirror match where the resist isn't ENTIRELY relevant or in an AD match up which they want armor. Outside of Swain there are next to no AP top laners in the current meta so the top lane tank usually don't have to get it first or second item. Meanwhile the jungle tanks NEED to get cinderhulk first and then transition into Warmogs in almost ALL games according to na.op.gg (Sejuani goes Warmogs second in over 50% of her games played with Zac having the exact same trend). So my point still stands that a tank on 2 items is going to have next to no magic resist in almost all scenarios.

Also, even if Maokai/Ornn does opt for an MR item (which is almost ALWAYS second item) its going to be a 55 MR item that is not adaptive helm because they synergize way too much with Spirit Visage/Abyssal Mask respectively so they will still get shredded by Cass because the opportunity cost of going adaptive is too high.

mf dodges sej's ult. She drops her make it rain, and she runs past sej. Sona flash crescendo's the other 4 enemies. Tf stuns sej while mf pops ult and deletes the other 4 enemies. You are now 5v1. You now deal with sej. Now, for a difficult problem?...

.....I know that you are Silver and all that, but even you must have the intellect and understanding to realize that a "guessed up" scenario such as the one you describe is extremely unlikely to ever actually happen in reality? In such a perfect manner? 

First up, a good Seju would never ulti and completely miss MF, the slow would hit, forcing Sona to ulti Seju to prevent her from going ontop of MF, that or run up infront of Seju to keep her from Q'ing the MF and chainstunning her.

Secondly, what kinda boosted animals would stand clustered enough for a Sona ulti to hit all of them? 

At this point MF´s own team will only have the option to try and disengage unless they are way ahead, MF has been caught too close to the front and Sona as well, half their backline is basically compromised.

Normally this ends with Seju soaking a ton of damage with her passive and then stoneplate before chainstunning enemy team to death.

That Scenario was already failed the moment Seju got the shot at ulting MF.

So... the over 50% miss rate by pro players means they just aren't good sej players? Add to that... sup or mid can block it for mf. Mf can flash it. I mean, these are GOOD players we're talking about right?... lol. It goes BOTH ways.

And the enemy team WILL be grouped up... because they're all mobbing your frontline who dove at them. So worst case scenario, you should be hitting adc (that your frontline mobbed), support (who's trying to peel like a good support), and probably either top or mid cuz... they're also peeling and trying to blow up your frontline. So that's a 3 man ult, that's saving your frontline and nabbing at least 2 kills. Which leaves you with 2 half hp frontline teammates, a damaged tf mid, a mostly full hp sona and mf (without ults) vs... a no ult no dash sej, and 2 enemies... one of whom has no flash and no cleanse or qss.

Last time I checked, the 5 will probably beat the 3 in that scenario. And if you're too low to wrap up the kills, you will... kite back, collapse on and kill sej, then base and... depending on death timers, use your newfound item advantage and full hp bars to 5v2 force an objective. Since everyone in the above scenario is a good player ya know.

And that is how we make swiss cheese of your scenario.

Didnt i specify that even if Seju misses the direct hit the aftereffect will still hit? The AOE is huge and is a disaster for MF who will lose her movespeed when the slow hits.

And what pro´s are we talking about? I´ve seen Korean seju mains land precision ults past 2 frontliners ontop of a squishy and lead their teams to collapse on that.

But i digress, the entire scenario you describe is pointless.......because guesswork when we dont even know the specific teamcomps is pointless.

Guesswork based on empty scenarios like these simply dont work, for all we know the Cassio could predict Sona´s flash and ulti perfectly and kill her instantly or just cause her to miss the opportunity.

That or Seju engages on Sona and lets her team get ontop of her first before moving towards MF, she barely takes any damage from MF with standard builds anyhow.

Not really. Despite the fact that champions like Amumu or Naut do "decent" damage, they are unable to be ignored because they offer tons of CC (Naut) or CC and tons of utility (Amumu adding 10% true damage to all magic damage dealers). Tanks are only balance nightmares when they have both tons of CC and tons of base damage (Maokai still has a near undodgeable 225 base ability on a 5 second cooldown that happens to have hard cc attached) while having next to no mana costs since tanks (while further circumventing mana issues with items like Glacial Shroud or Catalyst).

Mao damage isnt all that much unless he can somehow consistently land multiple bush saplings, as his W damage is single target and Q aoe isnt "that" big.

Amumu and naut will outdamage a mao in nearly every game, Naut with his E spam and amumu because he can hit multiple people with his W and E several times during a teamfight.  Only assassins and adcs complain about mao damage because once his W hits you he is guaranteed to land the rest of his kit on that target.

Maos damage is absurd in laning phase. He's a lane bully you can never shove out of lane since he WILL Q you every time you contest a creep and hardly run out of mana due to it costing a whopping 50 and even if you do try to fight back he has sustain while chances are you do not. Yes, his damage is lackluster at best, but during the laning phase he has waveclear and will outdamage most other non-lane bullies while building whatever resist compared to the damage you do. It's not NEARLY as bad now as before, but he is still obnoxious to play against and I would MUCH rather deal with pre-rework sapling max Mao because he actually ran out of mana despite doing a bit more damage.

Tanks would need to have near constant hard and soft CC if they didnt have enough damage to warrant them being a threat during a fight.  THis just isnt feasible in a muliplayer PVP game unlike how it is in party based PvE games where "tanks" are damage soaks and have large access to damage mitigation and agro pulling mechanics.

Tanks need to deal damage in their kit so that they can lane/jungle and also not just become a giant meatshield during the mid-late game.  The real balance hiccup is when a tank dives 1v3 and kills the ADC/other squishy in one or less rotation, but IMO there is nothing wrong when a tank solo kills the enemy ADC when their support abandons them and the ADC eats multiple rotations of the tanks skills.

This is a misconception that I feel  I need to clear up . {{champion:102}}  is not a tank, she is a bruiser. To be a tank you need 2 things. 

1. Some form of damage mitigation built into your kit.
2. Hard cc.

If you dont have both of these , you are not a tank, for you cannot soak damage as  well s a tank, regardless of what you build, and you cannot peel.
